events.title: Countdown to Victory: D-Day Approaches as Allied Forces Prepare for July 9th Offensive
events.description: NARRATIVE OF THE OPERATION. D-1 Day. Friday, 9th July, 1943.

events.title: Fury from the Skies: Dutch Bomber Assaults Targeting Key Locations (July 9 – September 5)
events.description: (f) Attacks with Bombs launched by Aircraft from Holland (9th July to 5th September).

events.title: Allied Forces Gain Ground in Euphrates Province, Threaten Homs and Advance on Beirut
events.description: (n the Euphrates Province the roth Indian Division made steady progress in the face of heavy air attacks, and by the 8th July, with the capture of Raqga and Kameschle, they were in control of the key points of the Province. On the line Hama—Homs—Anti-Lebanon the Vichy French were thinning out, until on the roth July Homs was threatened by the 4th Cavalry Brigade who had cut the railway to the South and now stood before the town. The crossing of the River Damour by the r7th Australian Infantry Brigade on the 7th July, and the capture of the town itself by the 21st Australian Infantry Brigade on the 9th July removed the chief obstacle to our advance on Beirut from the South. The town was also threatened from the direction of Damascus by the 16th Infantry Brigade (6th Division), which
